title: Instructional Technology: Introductory Level (up to Grade 5)
subject: PASS (2011-)

486EECEF621B4FC5A899F3DA1A7BD5BC.description:
Evaluate the accuracy, relevance, appropriateness, comprehensiveness, and bias of
electronic information sources.

4C4E6EB7B9E446278B0C2BA289A1787B.description:
Determine which technology is useful and select the appropriate tool(s) and
technology resources to address a variety of tasks and problems.

0D5E21678E1845718C27854106EC61A4.description:
Use technology resources (e.g., calculators, data collection probes, videos,
educational software) for problem solving, self-directed learning, and extended
learning activities.

61FEE775B64543DFA587B9C58065D8C8.description:
The student will demonstrate knowledge of technology problem-solving and
decision-making tools.

ACEE902AD9DB4BD4A3C2AF93DF00A289.description:
Determine which technology is useful and select the appropriate tool(s) and
technology resources to address a variety of tasks and problems.

80703901829245598876DCD7AD8A3E01.description:
Use technology resources (e.g., calculators, data collection probes, videos,
educational software) for problem solving, self-directed learning, and extended
learning activities.

3A28A6FF79554658923549BFD92EAB3F.description:
Use telecommunications and online resources (e.g., e-mail, online discussions, Web
environments) to participate in collaborative problem-solving activities for the
purpose of developing solutions or products for audiences inside and outside the
classroom.

BEE969A25E034DBEA9C52402F709E9F7.description: The student will demonstrate knowledge of technology research tools.

BFEE157DE896429995EBA5A67DDF37E3.description:
Use telecommunications and online resources (e.g., e-mail, online discussions, Web
environments) to participate in collaborative problem-solving activities for the
purpose of developing solutions or products for audiences inside and outside the
classroom.

753C05F794E249C78E5073744E8439B2.description:
Use telecommunications efficiently to access remote information, communicate with
others in support of direct and independent learning, and pursue personal interests.

C80EE1F33EFD405B84C6F8FA3E55C0BF.description:
Use technology tools (e.g., multimedia authoring, presentation, Web tools, digital
cameras, scanners) for individual and collaborative writing, communication, and
publishing activities to create knowledge products for audiences inside and outside
the classroom.

71B5EA48CB4E43669DE73922D77B9366.description: The student will demonstrate knowledge of technology communications tools.

F48EA2006E1E49C182ABCA35BCA3F08D.description:
Use technology tools (e.g., multimedia authoring, presentation, Web tools, digital
cameras, scanners) for individual and collaborative writing, communication, and
publishing activities to create knowledge products for audiences inside and outside
the classroom.

ACB03CBCDB6D4363BCA2B3FCD4A257A2.description:
Use general-purpose productivity tools and peripherals to support personal
productivity, remediate skill deficits, and facilitate learning throughout the
curriculum.

776A359EBEF0487DBCD9161C29B01C38.description: The student will demonstrate knowledge of technology productivity tool.

674FF1E4F9064665AC1810E7BBFCBCC4.description:
The student will demonstrate knowledge of social, ethical, and human issues,
discuss basic issues related to responsible use of technology and information
and describe personal consequences of inappropriate use.

669E20FE187646FFB249DD8020683513.description:
Discuss common uses of technology in daily life and the advantages and
disadvantages those uses provide.

1BA467DCFCAC430AAE0FAD6033CA43DB.description:
Use keyboards and other common input and output devices (including adaptive
devices when necessary) efficiently and effectively.

4FA9B3138CFA43A4ADE235EC8AF0F629.description: The student will demonstrate knowledge of basic operations and concepts.
